From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia


This article needs a plot summary. Please add one in your own words. (March 2024) (Learn how and when to remove this template message)
2023 American filmBlood for DustFilm posterDirected byRod BlackhurstWritten byDavid EbeltoftProduced byNoah LangMark FasanoBernard KiraArun KumarAri NovakStarringScoot McNairyKit HaringtonJosh LucasStephen DorffCinematographyJustin DerryEdited byJustin OakeyMusic byNick BohunProductioncompanies
Gramercy Park Media
Nickel City Pictures
Witchcraft Motion Picture Company
Distributed byThe AvenueRelease dates
June 2023 (2023-06) (Tribeca Film Festival)
April 19, 2024 (2024-04-19) (United States)
CountryUnited StatesLanguageEnglish
Blood for Dust is a 2023 American action crime thriller film written by David Ebeltoft, directed by Rod Blackhurst, produced by Noah Lang, Mark Fasano, Ari Novak and Nathan Klingher and starring Scoot McNairy, Kit Harington and Josh Lucas.
The film is scheduled to be released in the United States on April 19, 2024.


Cast[edit]
Scoot McNairy as Cliff[1]
Kit Harington as Ricky[1]
Josh Lucas as John[1]
Nora Zehetner as Amy
Ethan Suplee as Slim
Stephen Dorff as Gus
Production[edit]
In May 2022, it was announced that McNairy, Harington and Lucas were cast in the film.[2][3][4]
The film was shot in and around Billings, Montana.  Filming wrapped in December 2022.[5]

Release[edit]
The film premiered at the Tribeca Film Festival in June 2023.[6]
The film had its European premiere at the Deauville American Film Festival in France on September 3, 2023.[7][8] The film later had its UK premiere at the Raindance Film Festival where the film was nominated for Best International Film as well as McNairy for the Best Actor Award. It later won Best Feature at the San Diego International Film Festival.
In March 2024, The Avenue acquired the distribution rights to the film, with a release date of April 19, 2024.[9]

Reception[edit]
On the review aggregator website Rotten Tomatoes, 84% of 31 critics' reviews are positive, with an average rating of 6.5/10.[10]
Peter Debruge of Variety gave the film a positive review and wrote, "Bolstered by a strong, poker-faced ensemble with the good sense to underplay whatever menace each brings to the table, Blood for Dust does a fine job of making a familiar gambit feel unpredictable."[11]
Jordan Mintzer of The Hollywood Reporter also gave the film a positive review and wrote, "Well-executed without breaking new ground."[12]
Blood for Dust won the Best Feature award at the 2023 San Diego International Film Festival.[13]
